intro: Dasystachys melanocarpa, commonly known as the black-fruited spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically lanceolate in shape. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, which are surrounded by leaf-like bracts. Its fruits are globose, dry capsules that mature to a dark black color, giving the species its common name. Native to southern Africa, it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments.
